name: Compliance Dashboard - Back Office User View
description: Back Office users can monitor certificate of insurance compliance across all client companies through a comprehensive dashboard with summary metrics and detailed compliance records

background.text: I am logged in as a Back Office user

scenarios.name: Back Office user successfully views Compliance Dashboard with all components

steps.text: I navigate to the Compliance Dashboard
I should see the page header "Compliance Dashboard - Company Name"
I should see the subtitle "Manage and track certificate of insurance compliance"
I should see three summary metric cards at the top
I should see a "Compliance Records" section below the cards
I should see the compliance records list view

scenarios.name: Summary metric cards display correct data and formatting

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I should see the "Compliance Rate" card with a percentage value and light blue background
I should see the "Expiring Within 30 Days" card with a numeric value and light yellow background
I should see the "Expired Certifications" card with a numeric value and light red background
the compliance rate should be displayed as a percentage with no decimal places

scenarios.name: Compliance records list displays all required columns with correct data

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I view the compliance records list
I should see columns for Company Name, First Name, Last Name, ID Number, Status, Date Created, Role Type, Policy Effective Date, Policy Expiration Date, and Actions
I should see compliance records from all client companies
the Status column should display color-coded badges
the Role Type should display as a blue badge
the Actions column should show View, Edit, and Attachments icons

scenarios.name: Global search functionality filters compliance records correctly

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I enter a search term in the global search bar
I perform the search
the compliance records list should be filtered to show only matching records
the summary metrics should update to reflect the filtered results

scenarios.name: Filter options panel opens and applies filters correctly

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I click the "Filter" button
the filter options panel should open
I select filter criteria
I apply the filters
the compliance records list should display only records matching the filter criteria

scenarios.name: Export to Excel functionality works correctly

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I click the "Export" button
the compliance records should be exported to an Excel file
the exported file should contain all visible compliance records
the file should include all column data

scenarios.name: Status badges display correct colors based on compliance status

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I view compliance records with different statuses
records with "Compliant" status should display green badges
records with "Non-Compliant" status should display red badges
the status should be calculated based on all individual requirement statuses

scenarios.name: Search with no matching results displays appropriate message

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I enter a search term that has no matching records
I perform the search
I should see a "No records found" message
the compliance records list should be empty
the summary metrics should show zero values

scenarios.name: Filter with no matching criteria shows empty results

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I apply filters that exclude all records
the compliance records list should display no results
I should see an appropriate "No matching records" message
the summary metrics should reflect zero values

scenarios.name: Export fails gracefully when no records are available

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
there are no compliance records to display
I click the "Export" button
I should see an error message indicating no data to export
no file should be downloaded

scenarios.name: Invalid search characters are handled properly

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I enter special characters or invalid search terms
I perform the search
the search should handle the input gracefully
I should not see any system errors
the search results should be appropriately filtered or show no results

scenarios.name: Policy expiration date displays correctly for records with missing expiration dates

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I view records that have no policy expiration date entered
the Policy Expiration Date should display as one year from the effective date
the date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD

scenarios.name: Summary metrics calculate correctly with boundary date conditions

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
there are policies expiring exactly 30 days from today
I view the "Expiring Within 30 Days" metric
the count should include policies expiring on the 30th day
the calculation should be accurate for the current date range

scenarios.name: Dashboard handles large datasets without performance issues

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
there are a large number of compliance records
I view the dashboard
the page should load within acceptable time limits
the summary metrics should calculate correctly
the compliance records list should display with pagination if needed

scenarios.name: No manual Add Record button is displayed as records are auto-generated

steps.text: I am on the Compliance Dashboard
I view the compliance records section
I should not see an "Add Record" button
I should not see any manual record creation options
all records should be automatically generated via API integration

gherkin_content:
Feature: Compliance Dashboard - Back Office User View
  Back Office users can monitor certificate of insurance compliance across all client companies through a comprehensive dashboard with summary metrics and detailed compliance records

  Background:
    Given I am on the application
    And I am logged in as a Back Office user

  @smoke @positive
  Scenario: Back Office user successfully views Compliance Dashboard with all components
    Given I navigate to the Compliance Dashboard
    Then I should see the page header "Compliance Dashboard - Company Name"
    And I should see the subtitle "Manage and track certificate of insurance compliance"
    And I should see three summary metric cards at the top
    And I should see a "Compliance Records" section below the cards
    And I should see the compliance records list view

  @positive @metrics
  Scenario: Summary metric cards display correct data and formatting
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    Then I should see the "Compliance Rate" card with a percentage value and light blue background
    And I should see the "Expiring Within 30 Days" card with a numeric value and light yellow background
    And I should see the "Expired Certifications" card with a numeric value and light red background
    And the compliance rate should be displayed as a percentage with no decimal places

  @positive @list-view
  Scenario: Compliance records list displays all required columns with correct data
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I view the compliance records list
    Then I should see columns for Company Name, First Name, Last Name, ID Number, Status, Date Created, Role Type, Policy Effective Date, Policy Expiration Date, and Actions
    And I should see compliance records from all client companies
    And the Status column should display color-coded badges
    And the Role Type should display as a blue badge
    And the Actions column should show View, Edit, and Attachments icons

  @positive @search
  Scenario: Global search functionality filters compliance records correctly
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I enter a search term in the global search bar
    And I perform the search
    Then the compliance records list should be filtered to show only matching records
    And the summary metrics should update to reflect the filtered results

  @positive @filtering
  Scenario: Filter options panel opens and applies filters correctly
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I click the "Filter" button
    Then the filter options panel should open
    When I select filter criteria
    And I apply the filters
    Then the compliance records list should display only records matching the filter criteria

  @positive @export
  Scenario: Export to Excel functionality works correctly
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I click the "Export" button
    Then the compliance records should be exported to an Excel file
    And the exported file should contain all visible compliance records
    And the file should include all column data

  @positive @status-display
  Scenario: Status badges display correct colors based on compliance status
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I view compliance records with different statuses
    Then records with "Compliant" status should display green badges
    And records with "Non-Compliant" status should display red badges
    And the status should be calculated based on all individual requirement statuses

  @negative @search
  Scenario: Search with no matching results displays appropriate message
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I enter a search term that has no matching records
    And I perform the search
    Then I should see a "No records found" message
    And the compliance records list should be empty
    And the summary metrics should show zero values

  @negative @filtering
  Scenario: Filter with no matching criteria shows empty results
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I apply filters that exclude all records
    Then the compliance records list should display no results
    And I should see an appropriate "No matching records" message
    And the summary metrics should reflect zero values

  @negative @export
  Scenario: Export fails gracefully when no records are available
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    And there are no compliance records to display
    When I click the "Export" button
    Then I should see an error message indicating no data to export
    And no file should be downloaded

  @negative @validation
  Scenario: Invalid search characters are handled properly
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I enter special characters or invalid search terms
    And I perform the search
    Then the search should handle the input gracefully
    And I should not see any system errors
    And the search results should be appropriately filtered or show no results

  @edge-case @date-calculation
  Scenario: Policy expiration date displays correctly for records with missing expiration dates
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I view records that have no policy expiration date entered
    Then the Policy Expiration Date should display as one year from the effective date
    And the date should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD

  @edge-case @boundary
  Scenario: Summary metrics calculate correctly with boundary date conditions
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    And there are policies expiring exactly 30 days from today
    When I view the "Expiring Within 30 Days" metric
    Then the count should include policies expiring on the 30th day
    And the calculation should be accurate for the current date range

  @edge-case @performance
  Scenario: Dashboard handles large datasets without performance issues
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    And there are a large number of compliance records
    When I view the dashboard
    Then the page should load within acceptable time limits
    And the summary metrics should calculate correctly
    And the compliance records list should display with pagination if needed

  @alternative-flow @validation
  Scenario: No manual Add Record button is displayed as records are auto-generated
    Given I am on the Compliance Dashboard
    When I view the compliance records section
    Then I should not see an "Add Record" button
    And I should not see any manual record creation options
    And all records should be automatically generated via API integration
